title: Panic every 5 minute after restore from backup
body: ## Bug Report ### What version of TiKV are you using? Commit a9676d148e61f741ce9ee699f992b9ce06f91706 ### What operating system and CPU are you using? Ubuntu 20.04 ``` processor : 0 vendor_id : AuthenticAMD cpu family : 23 model : 49 model name : AMD EPYC 7B12 stepping : 0 microcode : 0x1000065 cpu MHz : 2249.998 cache size : 512 KB physical id : 0 siblings : 8 core id : 0 cpu cores : 4 apicid : 0 initial apicid : 0 fpu : yes fpu_exception : yes cpuid level : 13 wp : yes flags : fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush mmx fxsr sse sse2 ht syscall nx mmxext fxsr_opt pdpe1gb rdtscp lm constant_tsc rep_good nopl nonstop bugs : sysret_ss_attrs null_seg spectre_v1 spectre_v2 spec_store_bypass retbleed bogomips : 4499.99 TLB size : 3072 4K pages clflush size : 64 cache_alignment : 64 address sizes : 48 bits physical, 48 bits virtual * 8 cores ``` ### Steps to reproduce Create backup from 3h ago snapshot with tidb br. restore db. Get ``` Error: Clustered index option mismatch. Restored cluster's @@tidb_enable_clustered_index should be ON (backup table = true, created table = false).: [BR:Restore:ErrRestoreModeMismatch]restore mode mismatch ``` Restore all table in db one by one. ### What did you expect? comments_data.body:
Update, found an issue.
Steps to reproduce:

1. Drop database
2. Recreate it, changing the schema a bit - make clustered key non-clustered.
3. Back up data from a snapshot before dropping db. Backup will have clustered keys
4. Restore from snapshot
5. Database will try to decode keys with wrong schema
6. Cycle of panics

BR only support restoring tables to a cluster which either:
- Without table using the same name, in this case BR will try to create the table.
- A table with the same name and a compatible schema. In most cases, "compatible" means "the same".

When the schema isn't compatible, BR will do a restore without warranties. That is, it ingests the KV represents the upstream data to the cluster(**without** any efforts of modifying them compatible), the restored tables may be unavailable. ðŸ˜¢
